As long as the public keeps scooping it up (and paying for it), they are gonna keep slopping it out. No conscience, no thought, no morals...... sell, sell, sell! It's the Demographics that show that females between 13 and 30 drive that economy when it comes to what is sold and created. Everything is geared towards what they want and desire. Too much disposable income for little girls and parents who don't know what their little princess is doing. She is in that r-rated film with her girlfriend who can get them ID's. After she grows up she will get into the biggest and most expensive drama ever created outside of Hollyweird, yet inspired by some 14 year old producer who thinks wearing her underwear on the outside is cool. Maybe if parents control more of what their children are spending money on, then we can get the loons back on track with programming that everyone can enjoy. Another important tool is to just turn off the TV or change the channel when something weird comes on. TV's Parental controls work well in gearing your child towards a successful future and not one lined with posters and hopeless dreams.
